So proud and happy to be a part of the norway_chess social media team this year! As former World Chess Champion Garry Kasparov stated in 2014: “Norway Chess is the Wimbledon of Chess”, and reminiscent of other major sports events such as indeed Wimbledon, Norway Chess is the strongest chess tournament since 2013.

This year, the tournament takes place May 29 – June 9 with a total prize fund of 2,500,000 NOK (≈ €220,000), featuring World No.1 Magnus Carlsen, World No.2 Alireza Firouzja, professional streamer and 5-time U.S. Champion Hikaru Nakamura (more than 2.5M followers on Youtube & Twitch), 2018 Challenger Fabiano Caruana, 17-year-old Indian chess prodigy Gukesh, and more world-class players. 

The tournament is being broadcasted in English on the biggest chess platform, Chess.com (1.22M subscribers), and on TV2Sport (Norwegian). The main sponsors, like the NES Fircroft, HTH Kjøkken, Ernst & Young Norway, and Norway Summit, have more than 270 minutes of logo exposure every day on the days of the event from multiple channels - online and offline -, and all year brand awareness through our social media channels, and google image library.

Only Round 1 was watched live by more than 281k viewers in at least 3 different languages, while the content created for Round 1 by youtubers and streamers, surpassed the 150k views in the first 16 hours. Our Twitter account reached 739K impressions/day (208.5% growth), and Instagram 3.5k post interactions (329% growth) the first 24 hours with just 7.5k followers when the tournament started.

It’s a dream come true and I’m delighted to be around all these great professionals from around the world, and also my chess idols.

Exciting news for all chess enthusiasts! We are thrilled to announce that we will be the catering partner for the Youth Olympiad Chess, set to take place from August 12 to 19, 2023, at the hightechcampus. This international event will see hundreds of young chess players from all over the world competing against each other, and we are proud to provide healthy food that is essential for the cognitive function of the brain - something that is especially important for chess players.

The Youth Olympiad Chess is a significant event that will draw the attention of the international chess community. The country teams consist of boys and girls up to age 16, and in addition to the Olympiad, 10 of the world's strongest youth chess players will compete in a crowning group. 

The World Chess Federation (FIDE) has assigned this event to the Netherlands in 2023, as the knsb_schaken, the world's oldest national chess federation, celebrates its 150th anniversary this year. 

It's an honor to be involved in such an important event for the chess community, and we can't wait to be there to provide healthy and delicious food for all the participants.

* Parents and guardians will be able to know their child’s word automaticity and reading ability (word accuracy and words per minute)
* They will also receive recommendations for how to improve their child’s reading fluency over the summer  
* Invitation to join our summer virtual book club that aims to improve fluency
* Free literacy material giveaways to keep youth engaged in reading and writing throughout the summer such as journals, black literature, and more

Reading ability is a great predictor of future success. It is the foundation of all other learning (word problems in math; vocabulary in science; and primary sources in history). 

Joyous Tutoring improves the literacy of striving youth and particularly targets African-American boys and girls, though all youth are welcome, to address the present racial reading achievement gap here in Austin, TX.

Come join us in Chicago this summer (August 12-18) and play in the Pan America Youth Chess Championship that is being held for the first time in the United States! 
The tournament is open to all players from the United States, so don’t miss this once in a lifetime to play in this tournament. Register today at https://panamyouth2023.com/.
The Renaissance Knights Chess Foundation, the International Chess School, the United States Chess Federation, the Confederation of Chess for America, and the International Chess Federation (FIDE), are pleased to invite players under 18 years old (as of Jan 1, 2023) from North, South and Central America to play in the 33rd Annual Pan American Youth Championship. 
Players will participate in the following categories: Under 8 years old, under 10, under 12, under 14, under 16, and under 18; Open and Girls sections.
This is an international tournament where FIDE Titles and norms will be awarded to the top 3 players in each section. Trophies will also be awarded to the top players in each section. This will be a FIDE and US Chess rated tournament. Players may register online through the event website. Early entry fee is $250.00 through July 11 (This includes the $100 FIDE America fee).
The tournament is a 9-Round, Swiss with a time control of 90 minutes plus 30 second increment per move. The tournament schedule allows players and their parents the time to enjoy all Chicago has to offer. 
Arrival day is Friday August 11 and round 1 starts on Saturday August 12 at 4 PM. There will be one or two round(s) each day from August 12 – 18. On Friday August 18, the final round is at 9:30 AM and the closing ceremony is at 4 PM.
The organizers have arranged with the hotel a special rate of $200 (USD) for single - quad; plus tax at the Marriott Marquis Hotel that is connected to the playing sight.
To register for the tournament, make hotel reservations, or for more details visit https://panamyouth2023.com/.

يتردد مكسيم بيكافيه كونه من فريق الأحجار البيضاء، في الخطوة التي سيتخذها بين مربعات عدة سوداء تحيطه، ثم يتّخذ قراره واقفاً على القطعة القماشية التي تظهر عليها المربعات السوداء والبيضاء، في ظل نظرات زملائه الثلاثة الذين يشاركونه اللعب وأستاذه المتخصّص جان- فرنسوا بورشيه.

وبيكافيه البالغ 18 عاماً مُصاب بطيف التوحد، فيما يعاني زملاؤه أنجيلين وعثمان وإيثان اضطرابات معرفية. ويرتدي كل منهم تاجاً عليه الرمز الذي يمثله كقطعة في الشطرنج، فيضع أحدهم تاجاً يظهر رمز الأسقف مثلاً بينما يمثل تاج مراهق آخر الرخ (القلعة).

وسرعان ما تقصي أنجلين التي تفاخر كونها تمثّل القطعة الأقوى في اللعبة وهي الملكة، مكسيم من اللعبة. ويقول بورشيه، "لا يقتصر هدف هذه التجربة على الفوز والخسارة فقط، بل هم يختبرون اللعبة بأنفسهم". ويقول مكسيم "أتخيّل نفسي في مملكة".

The New York Times series Overlooked, a series of obituaries about remarkable people whose deaths, beginning in 1851, went unreported, has chosen to highlight Sultan Khan. This unassuming man from a small town in Punjab, from a family of landowners and pirs, went on to become a chess champion the world respected and rivals feared. He first became the All-India Chess Champion in 1928, and then won the British Chess Championship in 1929, 1932 and 1933. During a whirlwind period of four years, he competed against the world’s best chess players and more than held his own. He went back to India in 1933, and never played another chess match again. 

If you want to know more about this remarkable man, his grandchildren are said to be currently writing a book about him!

👍 𝑳𝒂 𝒃𝒊𝒃𝒍𝒊𝒐𝒕𝒆𝒄𝒂 𝒄𝒐𝒏𝒔𝒊𝒈𝒍𝒊𝒂
Paolo Maurensig scrive la biografia di Paul Morphy: uno dei più abili giocatori di scacchi di tutti i tempi, presentando anche uno spaccato della società ottocentesca. 
L' attenzione alla ricostruzione storica degli eventi è lodevole e la penna di Maurensig scorre veloce per una analisi introspettiva di Morphy che non annoia il lettore. Geniale la numerazione dei capitoli con le mosse della partita Paulsen - Morphy, New York 1857.
#labibliotecaconsiglia agli amanti del gioco degli scacchi e non. 

📚 Sommario/Abstract:
Sessantaquattro caselle. Trentadue figure. E una possibilità combinatoria pressoché infinita. Nessuna partita di scacchi è uguale a un'altra. Ognuna è una sfida unica, giocata su quel quadrato magico che è la scacchiera: quasi un mondo fuori dal mondo. Paul Morphy è stato un autentico artista della scacchiera, forse il più grande. Nella sua brevissima parabola, sospesa sull'esile filo che separa la genialità dalla follia, ha incarnato alla perfezione l'essenza del "nobile gioco". Paul nasce a New Orleans, da una famiglia facoltosa, nel 1837. Ha solo quattro anni quando rivela il proprio straordinario talento. A dodici anni è già il più forte giocatore della Louisiana e, non ancora maggiorenne, si laurea campione degli Stati Uniti con una facilità disarmante. A quel punto non gli resta che affrontare i più famosi campioni europei, e soprattutto quello che molti considerano il migliore al mondo: Howard Staunton. L'ambizione di Paul non conosce ostacoli. Come un cavaliere, sprezzante di qualunque premio che non sia la gloria, Morphy parte per la sua missione accompagnato da un ambiguo scudiero, il giornalista Frederick Milnes Edge, lasciando la solatia città natale per smarrirsi nelle nebbie londinesi. Chi era in realtà Paul Morphy? Quali accadimenti spensero la fiamma del suo genio, inducendolo ad abbandonare per sempre gli scacchi all'apice della carriera, e a ritirarsi?
